intro: Cynanchum gerrardi subsp. gerrardi, commonly known as the Carolina snakeplant, is a member of the Asclepiadaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, slender stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers in umbels, which are followed by follicles containing seeds. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate a variety of growing conditions.
